Find the general solution for the differential equation system

$\begin{cases}
x'(t)=2x+y \\
y'(t)=x+3y-z \\
z'(t)=-x+2y+3z
\end{cases}$
answer3:
$\begin{cases}
x(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+C_{2}e^{3t}(2\cos (t)-\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{3t}(\cos (t)+2\sin (t))\\
y(t)=C_{2}e^{3t}(\cos (t)+3\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{3t}(3\cos (t)-\sin (t))\\
z(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+2C_{2}e^{3t}\cos t+3C_{3}e^{3t}\sin t,
\end{cases}$
where $C_{1}, C_{2}, C_{3} \in \mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
$\begin{cases}
x(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+C_{2}e^{t}(2\cos (t)-\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{t}(\cos (t)+2\sin (t))\\
y(t)=C_{2}e^{t}(\cos (t)-3\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{t}(3\cos (t)+\sin (t))\\
z(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+5C_{2}e^{t}\cos (t)+5C_{3}e^{t}\sin (t),
\end{cases}$
where $C_{1}, C_{2}, C_{3} \in \mathbb{R}$.

question: If $u_1=-1$ and $u_8=20$, find the common ratio and the general term of the arithmetic sequence $(u_n)_{n \in \mathbb{N}}$.
answer1: The common ratio is 3 and the general term is $u_n=3n-4$.
answer2: The common ratio is 4 and the general term is $u_n=3n-4$.
answer3: The common ratio is 3 and the general term is $u_n=n-4$.
answer4: The common ratio is 4 and the general term is $u_n=n-4$.

question:
Discuss the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
3x & + & 2y & - & z & + & 2t & = & 1\\
x & - & y & + &2 z & - & 4t & = & -1\\
-x & - & 2y & - & z & + & t & = & 0\\
2x & + & 3y & - & 2z & + & t & = & 2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has a unique solution.
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.

Consider the matrix 
$$A_k=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}
 1  & 1  & 0 \\
  -1 & -k  & k-1 \\
  3 & 2  & 2k+1
\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?
answer1: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, 1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$
answer3: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer4: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, -1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$

Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{2}\rightarrow \mathbb{R},$ $%
f(x,y)=e^{ax^{2}+by^{2}}$. It satisfies the equations:
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),
\dfrac{\partial^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abxyf(x,y).$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2af(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abxyf(x,y).$
answer3:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abf(x,y).$
answer4:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4bxyf(x,y).$

The Cost-Flower Corp. supplies its three retail stores ($L_1$, $L_2$, and $L_3$) from three suppliers ($P_1$, $P_2$, and $P_3$). The shipping cost per unit from each supplier $(i)$ to each retail store ($j$) is given below. Consider that the capacity for each supplier and the requirements for each retail store during the week are indicated in the following table:

\[
\begin{array}{lc|ccc|c}
& & L_1 & L_2 & L_3 & \text{Supply (units)}\\
\hline
&P_1 & 25  & 15 & 5 & 1000\\
\text{Suppplier } & P_2 & 15 & 10 & 0 & 1000\\
& P_3 & 20 & 10 & 10 & 1000 \\
\hline 
\text{Demand (units)} & & 500  & 1000 & 750  & \\
\end{array}
\]	

Suppose that each supplier $P_1$, $P_2$ and $P_3$ sells each unit at cost $80 u.m.$, $90 u.m.$ and $70 u.m.$, respectively. Afterwards, each retail store $L_1$, $L_2$ and $L_3$ sells each unit at price $200 u.m.$, $220 u.m.$ and $190 u.m.$, respectively. Use a computer (Solver Add-in in Excel) to determine the best distribution plan per week.
answer1: There are tied optimal solutions with the maximum profit equals to $266250~u.m.$;

A polygon is regular when:
answer1: All its sides have the same length and all angles have the same amplitude.
answer2: The parallel sides have the same length and opposite angles have the same amplitude.
answer3: All the angles have the same amplitude.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
 & & y & + & 3z & = & 2 \\
x &  &  & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,\frac{y}{2}\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,-2,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:
Find the inverse of $A=\left( 
 \begin{array}{rrrr}
1 & 3 &  1 & 2  \\ 
 5 & 8 &  5 & 3  \\ 
 0 & 4 &  0 & 0  \\ 
 2 & 3 &  2 & 8 \end{array}
\right)$.

There are two sets of letters, and you are going to pick exactly one letter from each set: $S_1=\left\{A, B, C, D, E\right\}$ and $S_2=\left\{K, L, M, N, O, P\right\}$. What is the probability of picking two vowels?
Consider the line $r$ which is the intersection of the planes $\pi_1: x-2y+z=1$ and $\pi_2: 2x+3y-z=0$. Choose the right answer.
answer1: The line $r$ has the direction of the vector $w=(1, -3, -7)$.
answer2: The line $r$ has the direction of the vector $v=(1, 3, -1)$.
answer3: The line $r$ is perpendicular with $v=(1, -2, 1)$ and is collinear with $u=(2, 3, -1)$.
answer4: The line $r$ is collinear with the vectors $v=(1, -2, 1)$ and $u=(2, 3, -1)$.
